result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest M. Davidson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Will be granted if Defendant successfully completes probation.
Comply with all conditions set forth by Agent.

records.addlTxt: 11:36  Defendant Forrest M. Davidson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich files an amended complaint. Plead to the charge  1 yr probation Court costs Expungment if successfully completes.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights DEF PLEADS GUILTY  to the amended complaint  Facts are correct    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTSThe     Court finds the defendant guilty of charges in the amended complaint and adjudicates defendant guilty  The  Court orders S/W Probation 1 year  Conditions : Compley with the conditions set by the agent. Court costs 443.00  Expungment will be granted if defendant successfully completes sentence.

10:51 Defendant Forrest M. Davidson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Def requests complaint be read. Court reads charging portion of complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. Froelich: $1000 signature bond. Nelson has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
